website_summaries.verdict: Resident Evil 4 branched out in a different direction than its predecessors, but its emphasis on action, fresh vile creatures, and superior controls were welcome improvements.
pros: Save the president’s daughter from a mysterious European cult
First Resident Evil game with a third-person perspective
cons: A port featuring few updates since its original release in 2005

customer_reviews.title: Very Flawed Controls Gave Me Killer Headache
customer_reviews.text: Played this on Gamecube way back in the day and I loved it. When I started playing this version all the graphics looked good and everything, but I immediately noticed how flawed the controls were. You can only move forward, back, left, or right at a time. Which makes it very difficult to maneuver your character around, especially during battle. The other thing is you can't move pan the camera around either making it hard to see what's going on around you. The motions on the screen gave me a really bad headache within about 20 minutes and I had to stop playing. I'm very disappointed, I was stoked to play this game again :(
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Looks aren't everything
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Wii Edition ten years ago. Bought this hoping to rekindle the awesomeness. The overall aesthetic follows the original, but sorely disappointed in the controls. It may not be fair to compare the Wii control scheme to Xbox One, but it's hard to ignore the awkward new movement controls. In fact, the controls are so clunky (as one other reviewer wrote), that I got nauseous after about an hour of play. For those who loved the Wii Edition controls, beware this game - the difference is jarring and may leave you longing to dust off your old Wii console.

Seems like a fun game if the controls were just a bit better.

product_meta.title: Resident Evil 4 - Xbox One Standard Edition
product_meta.description: Platform:Xbox One| Edition:StandardSpecial agent Leon S Kennedy is sent on a mission to rescue the U.S. President's daughter who has been kidnapped. Finding is way to a rural village in Europe, he faces new threats that are a departure from the traditional lumbering zombie enemies of the
feature_bullets: Legendary Visuals - Resident Evil 4 features a breathtaking visual style and effects.
Behind the Camera View - The camera follows you from behind and allows for intuitive and comfortable movement in this survival horror third-person shooter.
Hordes of Enemies - Tackle creatures that defy the laws of nature, including horrific new creatures infested by a threat called Las Plagas.
Advanced AI - Enemies are smarter than ever and will use their cunning abilities to team up and attack the player en masse.
Mercenaries Mode - A fast-paced test of skill where you can play as fan favorites like Wesker or Hunk on a mission to wipe out hordes of enemies to earn the high score.
